page.title: 02CARSPHAIRN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Carsphairn village was one of the first villages in the Stewartry to have a schoolmaster. He was appointed in 1723.At one time there were more than 60 pupils in the school, but now there are only 11. Most of the pupils live outside the village, and some of them travel more than 10 miles to get to school.The pupils' ages range from 5 years to 11 years. The school has one classroom, and one teacher, to teach all ages and all subjects. There is a dining room/kitchen where the meals are prepared for the pupils by the cook. Outside is a large play area, part of which is tarred, and part covered with grass. On the grass an adventure playground has been built,sponsored by the Community Council,started in 1982, and completed in 1983.
